column1: Flood and Coastal Engineering (with Project Risk Management) MSc
column5: Please note this course is accepting applications for September 2024 and January 2025 entry only.This master’s course will teach you how to apply cutting-edge technology and tools such as machine learning and AI to solve a range of flood and coastal engineering problems. Particular emphasis will be given to the challenges of climate change and to the introduction of modern techniques such as sustainability assessment, data analytics and machine learning. These will give you a range of sought-after skills and substantially increase your employability within the flood and coastal engineering sector.
column7: Fees for EU applicants – For entry in 2023/24 academic year, eligible EU applicants will have the same tuition fees as UK students to continue our support during this transition period. These fees will be applied for the duration of the course.
column9: 1 year full time, 14 months full time, 2 or 3 years part time
